thread.title: Enjoy the Bethesda Row festival
thread.title_full: Enjoy the Bethesda Row festival | Examiner.com

author: Jodi Emmer
title: Enjoy the Bethesda Row festival
text:
all weather entertainment jodi emmer Free admission to this weekend’s extremely fun and festive Bethesda Row Arts Festival . The area event will be held come rain, come shine, come snow or hurricane on the streets of Woodmont Avenue, Bethesda Avenue and Elm Street.
There will be a variety of food and drink available from the fifty plus establishments that are a part of the Bethesda Row Restaurant extravaganza. The food ventures from upscale to less upscale with choices from seafood to ice cream that will all be available at the festival so be hungry and thirsty there will be plenty to choose from.
From the Bethesda Metro station the walk is about four blocks so ride your bike or take a nice hike as parking will be a challenge for a change. The festival begins on Saturday, October Seventeenth from 11:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and Sunday October Eighteenth from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. And once again admission is free.
The event will be held completely outdoors so dress for any possible weather event you can possibly think of and then do the opposite. There will be live music from several local artists on the stage located at Elm Street and Woodmont Avenue.
As far as the music schedule consists of currently this is the lineup:
Saturday October 17;
11:00a.m. - 1:00 p.m. Rick Whitehead Duo which will be playing jazz guitar.
1:30p.m.- 3:30p.m. Seth Kibel will be playing
4:00p.m. – 6:00p.m. Colonel Josh will be playing acoustic blues
Sunday October 18
10:00 a.m. –noon Todd Baker and Andrew Brown will be playing jazz guitar
12:30p.m. – 2:30p.m. Julie Mack will be playing Latin Jazz
3:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. Justin Trawick will be playing
Bethesda Row Arts Festival will also be hosting a charity art sale to raise funds and help create awareness of illness and expenses involved for the NIH Children’s Charities. Please buy something and show your support for a great cause that takes into consideration the youngest and most vulnerable of patients and support for their parents who endure these painful experiences.
